entry.title: Past continuous and past simple
entry.content:
Past simple

Past simple shows us that action was in the past , not in the present.

postitive sentence

My parents called me yesterday.
I woke up early this morning.

negative sentence

My parents didn't call me yesterday.
I didn't wake up this morning.

question sentence

Did your parents call you yesterday?
Did you wake up this morning?

Past continuous

The past continuous shows us that the action was already in progress at a certain time in the past.

What are you doing at 8 p.m. last night? I was studying.
She couldn't come to the party. She was working.
Three years ago, we were living in my home town.

Past continuous and past simple

When we use these two tenses together, it shows us that the past simple action happened in the middle of the past continuous action, while it was in progress.

While i was studying, i suddenly felt sleepy.
I broke my leg when i was skiing.
As i was going to work, i saw an old friend.

entry.title: Countable and uncountable nouns
entry.content:
countable nouns

For positive sentence we can use a/an for singular nouns or some for plurals.

There's a man at the door
I have some friends in New York.

For negatives we can use a/an for singular nouns or any for plurals.

I don't have a dog.
There aren't any seats.

uncountable nouns

for positive sentence: some
for negative sentence: any

question

  1. In question we use a/an, any or how many with countable nouns.
  2. We use any or how much with uncountable nouns.
  3. but we use some when we are offering something or asking for something.
  4. We also use some in question when we think the answer will be 'yes'

entry.title: Articles
entry.content:
哪些情况下是不用冠词的，哪些情况是用冠词的

common phrases

We don't use an article in expressions with school, university, prison and hospital.

go to bed
go to work
go home
go to hospital
go to prison

but we use the if someone visting with schoo, university, prison and hospital.

My son has started school now. I went to the school to meet his teacher.
I went to the prison a lot when I was a social worker.

place names

We don't use an article for continents, most countries, cities, towns, lakes, mountains or universities.

Africa, Asia
India, China
New York, Moscow
Mount Everest
Cardiff University

Some countries are different. Country names with United have the.

the United Kingdom, the United States of America
the Bahamas

Seas and Oceans, mountain ranges and rivers have the:

the Atkabtic, the Pacific
the Andes
the Nile, the Amazon

University with of in the title also have the:

the University of Cape Town
the University of Tokyo

entry.title: Adjectives ending in '-ed' and '-ing'
entry.summary: The difference in both of them is whether describe the feels of people(some animals) or object.
entry.content:
The difference in both of them is whether describe the feels of people(some animals) or object.

-ed

describe emotions - they tell us how people feel.

I was so bored in that lesson.
He was surprised to see Helen after all those years.

-ing

describe the thing that cause the emotion - a boring lesson makes you feel bored.

I can't sleep! That noise is really annoying!
I could listen to her for hours. She's so interesting.

entry.title: A, An, The
entry.summary: 单数的可数名词总是有冠词来修饰，例如a, an, the或者其他限定词
entry.content:
单数的可数名词总是有冠词来修饰，例如a, an, the或者其他限定词

a, an

when we talk about something for the first time, or something that is part of a group or type.

We use a when the word that follows it begins with a consonant soud.
We use an when it's followed by a vowel sound.

I saw a good film yesterday.
Do you want a drink?
She has a university degree.
It took me an hour to get home.

the

when the listener already knows which thing we are talking about because it was mentioned before or because there's only one of them.

I'm going to take the dog for a walk.
Have you seen the car key?

no article

we normally use a plural or uncountable noun with no article

Birds eat worms
Children need a lot of sleep

examples

a book
a desk
an elephant
an hour(h不发音，所以参考后面的o)
a hospital
an egg
an umbrella
an actor
a doctor
a university(u的发音和You很像，所以用a)

entry.title: PowerShell配色
entry.summary: 原始配色过于丑陋，实在是不能忍，故寻找合适的配色方案
entry.content:
原始配色过于丑陋，实在是不能忍，故寻找合适的配色方案

  1. 打开 这里 , 下载Color Tool
  2. 参考 这里 的说明配置自己喜欢的颜色方案即可
  3. 我选择的是OneHalfDark
  4. 简单贴一下命令：
cd c:\users\xxx\download\colortool
.\ColorTool.exe -b .\schemes\OneHalfDark.itermcolors

entry.title: Windows的开发环境配置
entry.content:
开始配置吧！

安装Chocolatey

Chocolatey是一个Windows下的包管理工具，类似Mac下的Alfred

@"%SystemRoot%\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -InputFormat None -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))" && SET "PATH=%PATH%;%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\chocolatey\bin"

如果遇到问题，请参考链接

安装Node.js

choco install nodejs

安装Hexo

使用npm安装Hexo

npm install hexo-cli -g

安装配合Hexo使用的Git

npm install hexo-deployer-git --save

entry.title: chapter4
entry.content:
不定词短语

to + 原形动词组成的短语

entry.title: chapter3.md
entry.content:
动词时态

简单式

  1. 简单式的时间是括弧形状的，也就是说可以包裹起来，可以是过去，现在和未来。be当作动词来看待

  2. 例句：

    The U.S established diplomatic relations with the P.R.C in 1979.

    此句中1979这个是时间点，并且1979是属于过去的时间，所以establish用过去式即established

    I was visiting clients the whole day yesterday

    the whold day yesterday表明时间点是扩在这里，所以be动词应该是过去式，visiting clients表示一个现在分词，意思是正在，一直的意思，所以用visiting

    7-ELEVEN is selling big cokes at a discount this month

    this month表示now的意思，所以用is。而打折正在进行中，所以用selling。

    Don't call me at six tomorrow. I'll be sleeping then.

    at six tomorrow是将来的一个时间点，I'll be sleeping then表示明天6点正在睡觉

完成式

  1. 相对于简单式用括弧来确定时间，完成式则用箭头形状来表达时间，表示动作的截止时间

  2. 完成式只表明动作“曾经，做过”

  3. 例句：

    I'm sure i have seen this face somewhere

    只能确定是看过但是无法确认是什么时间看到过的，表示过去到现在截止，用have been表示完成

    I had been smoking three packs of cigaretters a day before i decided to quit

    此处"decided to quit"已经是过去的时间，而"before i"则表明是过去的过去，所以用"had been"

    Next April, i will have worked here for 20 years

    将来完成时，从过去到将来的某一个时间点完成了什么

entry.title: chapter2.md
entry.content:
名词词组与冠词

名词短语

  1. 由三个部分组成，第一个部分是限定词（a, many, 等），第一个部分决定第三个部分的范围（单复数形式），第二个部分是形容词，用于修饰名词。

什么时候不需要限定词

  1. a(n)可以视为是one的弱化结果
  2. 除了复数外，抽象名词（虽然是具体的东西，但是形状并不固定）也不能以“一个”来表示

专有名词和补语位置

  1. 人名和地名都是专有名词，因为它所代表的对象只有一个，也不适合加a(n)
  2. 主语是专有名词时，主语补语也为专有名词，宾语亦是同理

the

  1. the可以视为是that或those的弱化形式
  2. 上下文有明指或者暗示时，也就有“那个”指示功能时用the
